title: Filson Logo Typeface
content:
Hi everyone. I am working on a project and am trying to find out the name of the typeface or typefaces used in the Filson logo. I have attached it here and would appreciate any help in identifying exactly what it is or something close. Appreciate any time and assistance in advance!!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Filson\_Logo\_original.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150402034942/http:/typophile.com/files/Filson_Logo_original.jpg) | 57.8 KB |
author: baconpress

comments.content:
\_FILSON\_ looks widened and perhaps boldened and perhaps has other changes.  
\_SINCE 1897\_ might be close to a font.  
Closest match I found so far is Goudy Catalog

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150402034942im_/http:/typophile.com/files/GoudyCatalogAsSince1897_4331.gif)
  [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/goudy-catalogue/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150402034942/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/goudy-catalogue/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/goudy-catalogue/")  
An also ran is Stratford 
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150402034942im_/http:/typophile.com/files/StratfordAsSince1897_6347.gif)
  [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/stratford/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150402034942/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/stratford/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/stratford/")  
Using Stratford Medium might work as a base for making \_FILSON\_ 
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150402034942im_/http:/typophile.com/files/StratfordMediumAsFILSON_5708.gif)
 if it is widened 130%  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150402034942im_/http:/typophile.com/files/StratfordMediumWidth130pctAsFILSON_4235.jpg)
  
Don

Hoefler Text Bold, stretched and squashed, would also make a good basis for recreating the look of |FILSON| (you’d also have to refine the serifs):  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/apple/hoefler-text/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150402034942/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/apple/hoefler-text/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/apple/hoefler-text/")

Or use Hoefler Titling Bold, which has finer serifs:  
 [http://www.typography.com/fonts/hoefler-titling/styles/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150402034942/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/hoefler-titling/styles/ "http://www.typography.com/fonts/hoefler-titling/styles/")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150402034942im_/http:/typophile.com/files/HoeflerTitling_4664.png)

You could try the Small Caps from Hoefler Text Bold, here shown as is -- which is an approximate fit as is for some letters -- and with width expanded 130% -- which is an improved fit for \_S\_

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150402034942im_/http:/typophile.com/files/HoeflerTextBoldSCand@Width130pctAsFILSON_SM_5934.jpg)
  
Don
